headline.print_headline: Principal Is Removed Over Students’ Records
headline.seo: Principal at Tapco in Bronx Is Removed Over Students’ Records
headline.main: Principal Is Removed Over Findings of Falsified Student Records

docs.snippet: New York City investigators found falsified student transcripts and credit given for courses, leading to the granting of unearned diplomas to some Theatre Arts Production Company School students....
docs.abstract: Lynn Passarella is removed as principal of the Theater Arts Production Company School in the Bronx; New York City Education Department investigation had determined that Passarella and her staff had falsified middle and high school student transcripts for years, awarding some students diplomas they had not earned and creating an artificially high graduation rate for the school.
docs.lead_paragraph: New York City investigators found falsified student transcripts and credit given for courses, leading to the granting of unearned diplomas to some Theatre Arts Production Company School students.

docs.snippet: Corrections appearing in print on March 10, 2012....
docs.lead_paragraph: Corrections appearing in print on March 10, 2012.

docs.snippet: The successful private debt swap by the Greek government will leave most of its debt in the hands of public sector lenders....
docs.lead_paragraph: The successful private debt swap by the Greek government will leave most of its debt in the hands of public sector lenders.

headline.print_headline: Executive Pay Capped at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac
headline.main: Executive Pay Capped at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac

docs.snippet: The regulator for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac slashed salaries for the chief executives of the two agencies and ruled out bonuses for many top executives....
docs.abstract: Federal Housing Finance Agency, regulator for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, slashes salaries for the chief executives of the two agencies and rules out bonuses for many top executives.
docs.lead_paragraph: The regulator for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac slashed salaries for the chief executives of the two agencies and ruled out bonuses for many top executives.

headline.print_headline: Discreetly Digital, Erotic Novel Sets American Women Abuzz
headline.seo: An Erotic Novel, ‘50 Shades of Grey,’ Goes Viral With Women
headline.main: Discreetly Digital, Erotic Novel Sets American Women Abuzz

docs.snippet: The book, “Fifty Shades of Grey,” by an obscure author, E L James, has been described as “Mommy porn” and “Twilight” for grown-ups....
docs.abstract: Fifty Shades of Grey, erotic novel by obscure author E L James, has found a rapt audience among women nationwide; book's small Australian publisher has had trouble printing copies fast enough to satisfy demand, as excitement spreads on Facebook and by word of mouth; Vintage Books has won an intense bidding war for the rights to re-release it in blockbuster fashion.
docs.lead_paragraph: The book, “Fifty Shades of Grey,” by an obscure author, E L James, has been described as “Mommy porn” and “Twilight” for grown-ups.

headline.print_headline: Austin, Proud of Eccentricity, Loses a Favorite
headline.seo: Austin, Proud of Eccentricity, Loses a Favorite
headline.main: Austin, Proud of Eccentricity, Loses a Favorite

docs.snippet: Emotions ran high this week as news spread of the death of Albert Leslie Cochran, a cross-dressing, often homeless man who embodied the city’s “Keep Austin Weird” spirit....
docs.abstract: Residents of Austin, Tex, mourn the death of Albert Leslie Cochran, a cross-dressing often homeless man who was also an occasional candidate for mayor.
docs.lead_paragraph: Emotions ran high this week as news spread of the death of Albert Leslie Cochran, a cross-dressing, often homeless man who embodied the city’s “Keep Austin Weird” spirit.

headline.print_headline: N.Y.U.’s Plan For Expansion Draws Anger In Community
headline.seo: N.Y.U. Expansion Plan Upsets Some Greenwich Village Neighbors
headline.main: N.Y.U.’s Plan for Expansion Draws Anger in Community

docs.snippet: The project’s future has fallen on the shoulders of two high-profile politicians who aspire to become the city’s next mayor....
docs.abstract: New York University proposal to erect four buildings north of Houston Street, perhaps the largest project ever proposed for Greenwich Village, faces fierce opposition from area residents who fear the destruction of one of New York City's signature neighborhoods; project’s future has fallen on the shoulders of two high-profile politicians, Christine C Quinn and Scott M Stringer, who both aspire to become the city’s next mayor.
docs.lead_paragraph: The project’s future has fallen on the shoulders of two high-profile politicians who aspire to become the city’s next mayor.

docs.snippet: As Mitt Romney campaigns in the Deep South, his attempt to connect with southern voters is exposing some of his greatest weaknesses....
docs.abstract: Charles M Blow Op-Ed column contends that the Republican presidential primaries in Alabama and Mississippi are a litmus test of whether Mitt Romney can connect with deeply conservative voters who do not fully trust or endorse him.
docs.lead_paragraph: As Mitt Romney campaigns in the Deep South, his attempt to connect with southern voters is exposing some of his greatest weaknesses.

headline.seo: Cincinnati Stuns Syracuse in Big East Tournament

docs.snippet: The Bearcats got off to a torrid start Friday by jumping out to a 25-8 lead against the Orange, who have never won the Big East championship in six appearances as the No. 1 seed....
docs.abstract: Cincinnati defeats Syracuse, 71-68, to win the men's college basketball Big East title.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bearcats got off to a torrid start Friday by jumping out to a 25-8 lead against the Orange, who have never won the Big East championship in six appearances as the No. 1 seed.

headline.print_headline: The Bad News Is Good News
headline.seo: The Bad News Is Good News
headline.main: The Bad News Is Good News

docs.snippet: Want to know why we can’t get the dog-on-the-roof story straightened out? Just look at the latest happenings in Mittworld....
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column criticizes Mitt Romney for supporting the Republican proposal to allow employers to refuse to provide health care coverage for contraception if they have moral objections to birth control; asserts that the good news is that the more the party argues over the issue, the more it loses votes, money and sympathy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Want to know why we can’t get the dog-on-the-roof story straightened out? Just look at the latest happenings in Mittworld.
